meanings.definition: Sentences that contain every letter of the alphabet at least once.
meanings.sent1: I enjoy creating pangrams for fun.
meanings.sent2: The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog is a famous pangram.
meanings.sent3: The detective used a pangram to solve the mysterious code.
meanings.sent4: Her handwriting was like a beautiful pangram, flowing effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: Learning about pangrams made me appreciate the complexity of language.

meanings.definition: A sentence that includes all 26 letters of the English alphabet.
meanings.sent1: Can you think of a pangram off the top of your head?
meanings.sent2: The pangram 'Pack my box with five dozen liquor jugs' is quite clever.
meanings.sent3: The teacher challenged the students to create their own pangram.
meanings.sent4: His speech was like a well-crafted pangram, covering all aspects thoroughly.
meanings.sent5: The pangram exercise helped the students remember all the letters of the alphabet.
